name: payoys-cursor-sub-agents
description: Brader Payoy's personal Cursor Agents setup with 15 commands, 14 agents, 15 skills, 5 rules, and hooks for modern web development
author: Brader Payoy

commands.name: new-task
commands.description: Analyze code for performance issues and suggest optimizations

commands.name: agents-md-generate
commands.description: Generate AGENTS.md file documenting project coding patterns, structure, and standards

commands.name: commit-best
commands.description: Create a well-structured commit with proper message and push

agents.name: tech-stack-researcher
agents.description: Research and recommend technology choices for feature development

agents.name: backend-architect
agents.description: Design reliable backend systems with focus on data integrity, security, and fault tolerance

agents.name: deep-research-agent
agents.description: Specialist for comprehensive research with adaptive strategies and intelligent exploration

agents.name: frontend-architect
agents.description: Create accessible, performant user interfaces with focus on user experience and modern frameworks

agents.name: learning-guide
agents.description: Teach programming concepts and explain code with focus on understanding through progressive learning

agents.name: performance-engineer
agents.description: Optimize system performance through measurement-driven analysis and bottleneck elimination

agents.name: refactoring-expert
agents.description: Improve code quality and reduce technical debt through systematic refactoring and clean code principles

agents.name: requirements-analyst
agents.description: Transform ambiguous project ideas into concrete specifications through systematic requirements discovery

agents.name: security-engineer
agents.description: Identify security vulnerabilities and ensure compliance with security standards and best practices

agents.name: system-architect
agents.description: Design scalable system architecture with focus on maintainability and long-term technical decisions

agents.name: technical-writer
agents.description: Create clear, comprehensive technical documentation tailored to specific audiences with focus on usability

agents.name: e2e-runner
agents.description: Design and execute best-in-class end-to-end tests with focus on reliability, coverage, and maintainability

agents.name: database-expert
agents.description: Optimize queries and ensure data access follows best practices with deep DBA expertise

agents.name: mcp-builder-expert
agents.description: Design and implement custom MCP servers tailored for systems or apps with protocol, transport, and deployment expertise

skills.name: api-design-patterns
skills.description: Apply RESTful and API design best practices for endpoints, error handling, and validation

skills.name: api-testing
skills.description: Structure and write API tests covering success, validation, auth, and error cases

skills.name: accessibility-checklist
skills.description: Verify WCAG 2.1 AA compliance for UI components

skills.name: e2e-playwright
skills.description: Write reliable Playwright E2E tests with Page Object Model and stable selectors

skills.name: security-audit
skills.description: Perform OWASP-aligned security checks on code and APIs

skills.name: refactoring-checklist
skills.description: Apply safe refactoring steps with behavior preservation

skills.name: requirements-discovery
skills.description: Structure requirements discovery and produce PRDs, user stories, and acceptance criteria

skills.name: docs-structure
skills.description: Structure technical documentation for APIs, guides, and README

skills.name: performance-profiling
skills.description: Measure before optimizing; identify bottlenecks with data

skills.name: code-review
skills.description: Review code for correctness, security, maintainability, and style

skills.name: feature-planning
skills.description: Break features into implementation tasks for backend, frontend, and E2E subagents

skills.name: postgresql
skills.description: Apply PostgreSQL best practices for schema design, indexing, vector search (pgvector), and RAG pipelines

skills.name: nosql-databases
skills.description: Apply NoSQL best practices for MongoDB, Convex, and document databasesâ€”query optimization, indexing, schema design

skills.name: mcp-builder
skills.description: Apply MCP protocol and SDK best practices for tools, resources, prompts, and server structure

skills.name: mcp-deployment
skills.description: Deploy MCP over Streamable HTTP with session handling and client URL; hosting and troubleshooting

rules.name: core-standards
rules.description: Core coding standards applied to all sessions

context7.description: Access up-to-date documentation for any library

playwright.description: Browser automation and web testing capabilities

cursor-config.description: Expose this repo's commands, skills, agents, rules, and hooks via MCP (run from repo root or set CURSOR_CONFIG_PATH)
